pageTitle: A more regular N26 night bus for Shoreditch and Hackney's social scene
description: Press releases and news articles from Transport for London

breadcrumbs.title: A more regular N26 night bus for Shoreditch and Hackney's social scene

title.title: A more regular N26 night bus for Shoreditch and Hackney's social scene

texts:
In support of Shoreditch and Hackney's thriving social scene Transport
        for London (TfL) will increase the frequency of the N26 night bus service from
        this Friday (20 June).

This will provide passengers in the area with more buses
        at weekends east towards Leyton, Walthamstow and Chingford, and west into central
        London to provide an easy interchange with other night bus services serving the
        rest of the capital.

This service improvement will see the
        weekend night bus services, Friday night/Saturday mornings and Saturday night/Sunday
        mornings, increase by two thirds with a bus every 12 minutes instead of the
        current 20 minute service.  The service
        improvement was made in response to an increase in passenger numbers seen on the
        route.

John Barry, TfL's Head of Network
        Development for buses, said: "Our night bus services are becoming increasingly popular and
        this service improvement on route N26 will give more capacity.  It is great our night buses are enabling more
        of our passengers to enjoy the thriving social scene that central London,
        Shoreditch and Hackney offer while also providing a lifeline to many people who
        work outside the nine to five routine."

This service change is part
        of TfL's management and development of a network that comprises around 700
        routes across Greater London operated by 7,600 buses at peak times, carrying
        more than 2.4 billion passengers every year. 
        TfL keeps the network under regular review, working with the London
        boroughs and other partners to help ensure that services can respond to
        London's changing travel needs.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Route N26 is operated by Tower Transit Ltd.  It operates Trafalgar Square (Charing Cross),
            Aldwych, Fleet Street, Ludgate Circus (City Thameslink), St Paul's, Mansion
            House, Bank, Liverpool Street Station, Shoreditch (High Street), Cambridge
            Heath, Well Street, Cassland Road (return via Wick Road), Hackney Wick,
            Ruckholt Road, Temple Mills, Leyton Station, Leyton Midland Road, Leyton
            (Bakers Arms), Walthamstow Central, Crooked Billet, Chingford Mount, Old Church
            Road, The Ridgeway, Chingford Station"]}
